Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: Ali Ahmed Kazi
Reviews.Content: So good in every aspect! esp after considering the price! I was scared after reading the rest of the reviews but this is really a great deal. Deserves a much better avg. rating.

Reviews.Title: Not a good computer for business purposes
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop at the beginning of the year to use for my business. I have experienced multiple bluescreen errors and the attachment are for the screen has separated several times when trying to open it. For some this may be a good computer but for me it is a piece of junk I plan on replacing as soon as I can research and find a laptop that meets the needs of my business.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: January
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to anyone. I haven't had a single problem. I mainly use it for some gaming, internet, and student stuff. Looks nice. The touchscreen is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: bonana
Reviews.Content: This computer is slim, light, sturdy, and feels nice to the touch. It DOES have a CD drive. I read several descriptions that said it did not have on. The one thing that i wish it had was back lit keys. Other than that this is perfect computer for the ever day user or someone that does a lot of work from home.

Reviews.Title: awesome stuff at fantastic price
Reviews.Author: girish lakhani
Reviews.Content: awesome stuff with touch screen option.great deal too.lucky to grab it at that price.luv it.will look out for more of these in future.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nifty
Reviews.Author: Scott Burtness "scottcycle"
Reviews.Content: Solid, fast, love the touchscreen. I also like Windows 8. Touch mouse pad is fine, not too touchy, not too sluggish.  Battery life is awesome.

Reviews.Title: a sleek machine
Reviews.Author: jbones
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty slick computer. It has a pretty thin body.  My wife loves the touch screen.  The huge hard drive should be pretty hard to fill.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: dadonamaz0n
Reviews.Content: perfect laptop for typical laptop users. plastic covering one of the hinges popped open and wont snap back in place (cosmetic issue only).

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had my laptop 2 months now and I love it. I have a tablet and the touchscreen feature is fantastic. Windows 8 is really easy after you get use to it.  Would highly recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: #Nice
Reviews.Author: moe
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent computer for the price. It's fast and lightweight. I'm new to windows 8 but I'm making progress.

Reviews.Title: Really Nice
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Best
Reviews.Content: Bought as a Christmas Gift for my daughter-in law who is a Nurse and a teacher at local collage, loves the touchscreen. I have one something like it and I knew she would like it.

Reviews.Title: Better than advertised
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This computer actually has 6gb of RAM not 4.  I was planning on upgrading the ram immediately, but I might wait.I cannot find any support documents for this laptop on the Lenovo website.  It's like it doesn't exist.The touch screen works well and is really great for windows 8.1.  The keyboard and touchpad leave a lot to be desired though.For the price I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: So far very good
Reviews.Author: murboyd "voracious reader"
Reviews.Content: Granted I have only owned this for just over a week, but I am very pleased. The screen is very clear, and I discovered that just angling it will increase or decrease the contrast of the picture. The keyboard is much easier to use than the old-fashioned kind, and I'm getting spoiled. I chose this Lenovo because I need the DVD drive, which seems to have gone the way of the dinosaur in laptops. I also wanted the headphone/mic jack. With those two essentials, the choice was limited.The Windows 8.1 has been a fun learn. I don't know all the ins and outs yet, but I really do like what I know of it so far.I see that others began having problems quite soon after purchase, but I have hopes. I am holding down the stars to 4 instead of 5, just because it is early in the game, but nothing has fallen off, the mouse pad still works, and the OS is as slick as anything Microsoft has come out with yet.One big advantage of laptops is that it has sure neatened up my desk! No big tower, no oversized monitor, no separate keyboard - I only now realize just how much space all those took up.

Reviews.Title: Great deal, great quality
Reviews.Author: Rebecca
Reviews.Content: Excellent! I got a superb deal on this little laptop and am in love. Great quality from Lenovo and I'm even adapting well to the Windows 8. Very pleased with large screen and keyboard set up (I don't accidentally hit the space bar, hooray!) Highly recommend if you are looking for a solid laptop for both work and play.

Reviews.Title: Overall work in progress model, needs upgrades
Reviews.Author: Aj
Reviews.Content: Pros- Overall looks sturdy and has a nice black steel like feel- Good option of touch screen and laptop features- Number of apps for free to download- Cloud storage and good performance of processor- Good Dolby soundConsHDMI - No audio transfer to external device when HDMI is connected. Have tried various things but hasn't worked so far. This is disappointing.Mousepad - Perhaps the most disappointing aspect of this laptop is the touchpad and the irritating 8.1 feature of windows charm. Despite all attempts to remove the charm, it remains a pain. Its the most annoying feature I've have ever seen.Hibernation/ Sleep - Shows black screen if you try open the laptop flap after hibernation or sleep. You will need to do a hard boot every time this happens. Tried changing the power options, it just remains the sameI don't think its a bad laptop, its just that windows 8.1 is still half baked and has pretty annoying features which makes this model less functional.

Reviews.Title: Great computer for the money
Reviews.Author: H. C. Waters "hcw714"
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer as a Christmas gift for my husband to replace an old HP.  He really likes it, but has had difficulty getting used to it.  The screen is very large, and easy to see.  The keyboard contains a standard alphabetical key plus the number keys to the side and is hard to get used to.  Also, since it is a touch screen, that has been difficult to adjust to.  However, it is a great computer for the money and once he learns to integrate the keyboard and touchscreen, I think he'll love it.

Reviews.Title: lap top
Reviews.Author: big j
Reviews.Content: will be my travel laptop good size battery life so far 6 hours easy to operate had no problems setting up

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, but I find it in another place 150 dls cheaper after buy it with you
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Perez Olivares
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, but I find it in another place 150 dls cheaper after buy it with you. This was a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Updated review from 2 to 4 stars...
Reviews.Author: ELY "Lovu"
Reviews.Content: We got this on sale at Office Max a couple weeks ago. I was really excited about what we were getting for the price and figured it was due to the fact that it's a lesser known brand. I read a ton of reviews and got an overall good feeling about Lenovo as a brand. We drove across town in crappy snow weather to get this laptop since the convenient store didn't have any in stock and we were sold on this computer.  The first laptop we brought home had a defective disc drive. I would hit the button to open it and it would jam- I had to force it to open. So I took it back and waited a week for another to be shipped from an out of town store.  The performance  seemed Ok as far as the basics that I used this for but this is limited usage so I can't say much there. Anything would seem great compared to the 7 year old Dell I was replacing. Windows 8 is confusing to me. I am a quick learner with technology but it is lacking instruction and everything seems to be hidden now. The touch screen seems pretty receptive but the mouse not so much. After a little use I've discovered that this laptop is obviously very cheaply made. I was willing to overlook the wobbly screen (annoying when using touch screen) and the smudge-attracting material this is made with but then I noticed tonight that the THIN little piece of plastic covering the keys (part of the keyboard) is not attached correctly. One edge of this piece is sticking up when it should be secured flat. I am taking this computer back to the store tomorrow. This has made a very bad impression on Lenovo for me & I will probably just pay a little more for a more reputable brand name. I want something that feels sturdy that I can be assured will last me awhile. I'd rather put my $550 towards something else.************So we decided to keep this computer. The experience has been pretty negative all the way around but I think I was a little harsh with my first review. It turns out that the edge of the keyboard piece that was sticking up was an easy fix- popped right into place with no issues since. After looking at some other laptops I discovered that this particular piece is flimsy and looks cheap on them ALL. For the money, this laptop was the best choice all the way around- speed, storage space, and reputation. I am loving the very responsive touch screen and even with my basic wifi-router the computer is impressively fast. I love the keyboard-soft, smooth keys and easy to use. So far I am adjusting to Windows 8 and haven't tried a lot of the features that this computer offers. I will do another update after I try some more stuff!

Reviews.Title: Well..... I've been spoiled, but this is bull.
Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: Hello, well this laptop is a very nice laptop in my opinion for actual physical hardware don't get me wrong on that, however the keyboard could feel a little more sturdy to me. But let's start off by saying that windows 8.1 (or 8 doesn't matter) sucks. Yes its touchscreen and what not but that does not make windows 8 not suck. Its terrible, no start button, and so many software glitches. The one that is causing me problems I am almost sure is a Windows 8 problem because ever since the day I upgraded to windows 8.1 (about 2 weeks after I bought it) I have been having a screen problem.  I have researched it online on many websites across many brands and almost every brand will have multiple people complaining about their screen not coming back on after it goes to sleep. Well I am one of the lucky ones to get this problem. So If you enjoy completely shutting your computer off so you wont lose any data every time you will be away from the laptop for 5 minutes, buy this. But if you are like most people and don't like doing this. Don't buy this. It happens about 4/5 times for me and so unless I am gonna be sitting typing for a long time and not walking off, it is almost unusable cause I have to hard restart it every time almost. And anything that is running I lose. I just don't understand how companies like Microsoft and Lenovo (whoever's fault it is for this problem) can't have simple stuff like waking from sleep mode solved by now... for goodness sake. I've only had this for a month and barely a half and it has glitched since about the 2 week mark, notice since I upgraded to Windows 8.1. And I've had my custom built gaming PC for over half a year with never one lag or problem on Win 7 Pro. Step it up Microsoft, please.GREAT laptop if you don't get the black screen problem 4/5 times you use it. But for me this is just not acceptable.
